newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: MALAYSIA STOCKS - factors to watch - April 28.
newsitem.headline: MALAYSIA STOCKS - factors to watch - April 28.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Malaysian stocks on Monday:
* On Wall Street, the Dow Jones industrial average shed 53.38 points to 6,738.87 on Friday.
* The Malaysian blue-chip Composite Index fell 7.08 points to 1,089.45.
* Thin volume of 236 million shares on Friday reassuring amid the Malaysian bourse decline, but analysts say the low turnover also shows that buyers remain sidelined.
* Ringgit at 2.5075/85 a dollar at 0900 GMT on Friday.

* The Dow's loss on Friday should not be a major drag on Malaysian stocks, said Ralph Dixon, of TA Securities' international division. "I think that's OK. It wasn't 100 points. We saw a trickle of buys at the end of the week, though it's still very slow."
* Computer Systems Advisers set to debut on Second Board with offer of 5.985 million shares at 2.80 ringgit each.
* Malaysian Airline System says will benefit from "open skies" agreement with the United States. Sees improvement in profits from the air travel liberalisation.
